alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 6:14PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne, northeastern Kimball and southern Banner Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles north of Dix to 10 miles south of Harrisburg to 12 miles north of Oliver Campground to 10 miles east of Albin. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Potter, Dix, Kimball Airport and Harrisburg. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 17 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
